content.question:
An amusement park keeps track of the percentage of individuals with season passes according to age category. An independent tourist company would like to show that this distribution of age category for individuals buying season passes is different from what the amusement park claims. The tourist company randomly sampled 200 individuals entering the park with a season pass and recorded the number of individuals within each age category.

Age Category 

Child (under 13 years old) 

Teen (13 to 19 years old) 

Adult (20 to 55 years old) 

Senior (56 years old and over) 

Number of Individuals 
56 
86 
44 
14 

The tourist company will use the data to test the amusement park’s claim, which is reflected in the following null hypothesis. <math alttext="H sub 0: p sub child equals 0.23" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>H</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow></msub><mo>:</mo><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>child</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.23</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="p sub teen equals 0.45" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>teen</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.45</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, <math alttext="p sub adult equals 0.20" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>adult</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.20</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, and <math alttext="p sub senior equals 0.12" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mi>p</mi></mrow><mrow><mtext>senior</mtext></mrow></msub><mo>=</mo><mn>0.12</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>. What inference procedure will the company use to investigate whether or not the distribution of age category for individuals with season passes is different from what the amusement park claims?

choices.label: A one-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a population proportion
A two-sample <math alttext="z" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>z</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a difference between population proportions
A matched pairs <math alttext="t" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-test for a mean difference

topic.text: 8.2: Setting up a Chi-Square Goodness of Fit Test

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Identify an appropriate inference method for significance tests.
